name: Coyote Moon Golf Course
description: At 6,300 feet above sea level, Coyote Moon is one of the finest mountain golf courses in the country. The course is a mountain masterpiece, carved out of 250 secluded acres of rolling hills, towering Ponderosa pines, wildflowers, and roaming wildlife, all without a single home or homesite to spoil the view. Coyote Moon combines a great design, meticulous maintenance standards, and attentive guest services to create a premier mountain golf experience.

faqs.question: What’s included in Coyote Moon golf group packages?
faqs.answer: Lodging, guaranteed tee times at Coyote Moon, carts, and concierge planning. Optional transportation, dining, and multi-course itineraries.

faqs.question: How much do Coyote Moon packages cost?
faqs.answer: Typical range is $199–$499 per golfer depending on season, lodging selection, and group size.

faqs.question: Do you handle corporate or tournament groups?
faqs.answer: Yes—room blocks, tee-time blocks, tournament setup, and logistics for corporate and leisure groups.

bodyText: At 6,300 feet above sea level, Coyote Moon is one of the finest mountain golf courses in the country.  The course is a mountain masterpiece, carved out of 250 secluded acres of rolling hills, towering Ponderosa pines, wildflowers, and roaming wildlife, all without a single home or homesite to spoil the view.  Coyote Moon combines a great design, meticulous maintenance standards, and attentive guest services to create a premier mountain golf experience.

tips.title: Golf The High Sierra
tips.content: Book your next group golf trip with us!

pointOfView: Pure. Wilderness. Golf. Simply enough, there really is no better way to express just what a round at Coyote Moon offers. But nature isn't the only enticement; the course layout is, with a few exceptions, absolutely outstanding. Numerous up- and downhill dog legs and constant elevation changes have made the most of the varying topography available to the designer, Brad Bell. Club selection, while taking the 6,300 feet above sea level elevation into account, is paramount if you want to avoid the steep banks, bunkers, and native areas that surround most green complexes. A range finder with an elevation adjustment is your best friend at Coyote Moon when you're after a low score. It will come in really handy as you decide what club to hit on the par 3 13th, which features a 200 foot drop over Trout Creek to the green below the tee box. If you're more interested in enjoying the surrounding aesthetic, you will find no better course to appreciate. The afternoon's long shadows and ever-present wildlife will create one of the most zen-like, tranquil golf experiences you'll find on earth, and that is no overstatement. The peace of the forest comes through soft and lightly as you manage each challenging shot. Take your time for this one! There is no reason to rush this kind of quiet.
contentParagraphs: Plan Coyote Moon in Truckee with golf groups, tee times, and stay-and-play packages. Expert planning for buddies, corporate, and leisure trips.

The 13th hole is a spectacular 227-yard par 3 where the tee shot falls more than 200 feet down to an oblong green fronted by Trout Creek and rugged native terrain. The hole plays two-to-three clubs less than normal, but pay attention to the pin location and adjust club selection accordingly. Take a deep breath, clear your mind and concentrate on the shot on this breathtaking and dangerous par 3.

At The Moon, you’re sure to experience wildlife up close like you never have while playing golf. You’ll want to take a moment to watch the herd of resident Mule deer bucks laze their way across a fairway, or the coyote pups as they frolic outside their den in the giant boulders behind the 12 green. A round at Coyote Moon offers more than pristine golf; it’s more an experience with nature.

featuredHole.description: The 13th hole is a spectacular 227-yard par 3 where the tee shot falls more than 200 feet down to an oblong green fronted by Trout Creek and rugged native terrain. Take a deep breath, clear your mind and concentrate on the shot on this breathtaking and dangerous par 3.

testimonials.quote: We've done golf trips all over the West, and Coyote Moon Golf Course is now a permanent stop. The condition was pristine, greens rolled true, and the mountain views are unmatched. GTHS set up our tee times perfectly.
testimonials.author: Stephanie A.

testimonials.quote: First time playing Coyote Moon Golf Course and it exceeded every expectation. The scenery alone is worth the trip, but the course layout is genuinely challenging and fair. Our whole group wants to come back.
testimonials.author: Gary S.

testimonials.quote: Coyote Moon Golf Course delivers every time. This was our third trip and the course keeps getting better. Par 3s are memorable, greens are quick and true. Best value for championship golf in the Truckee, CA area.
testimonials.author: Brandon T.
